reviews.review_msg: Lectures were taken from a course done at Yale (actually very interesting). Prof had smth going on this semester but grades were not given back within a reasonable time and I had no idea how I was doing in the class for most of the semester. Way too many readings for the expected time based on credits.

He is a difficult marker but gives clear and constructive feedback. Very willing to compromise and understanding of students need. He is willing to give a day or two extensions for the essays even if your reasoning is procrastination. Flexible with zoom meetings to help students analyze the harder texts.

Great Prof. Very energetic, which, coupled with his humor, makes for one fast lecture. He is also very interested in assissting students whenever they need help. His only downside is his slowness when it comes to marking papers and his tricky multiple chioce questions. Overall, highly recommended.
Funniest prof I've ever had. Should have his own sitcom. Great voice too, like a good documentary narrator's. His lectures are informative. Whatever the subject, he'll make it interesting.

Very intelligent and funny yet is very slow at marking. His class was interesting enough and if you express a disire to imporve he will give his time and effort so that you may do so. Enjoy- from a 3.77 student

Anyone who plays Monty Python for the class deserves a smily face.  One of the few professors at SFU who is truly not full of himself despite his intelligence.  He treats his students with great respect.  Lectures fast, but not boring.
such a sweetie! i love his class...he's so funny and he makes the material so interesting! class just seems to fly by!!!!

This is a very diificult course which is only exasperated by the haphazard manner in which he teaches. He takes a complicated subject and makes it more confusing with his lack of organization. He is quite funny though.
